achievement.translation[0].definitions[0: something important that you succeed in doing by your own efforts
His great achievement is to make all the players into a united team.
We try to celebrate the achievements of our students.
The test measures children’s achievements in reading, spelling, and maths.
achievement.translation[0].definitions[1: when you achieve something or when people achieve something
Roberts is researching the effect of social class on educational achievement.
As we climbed the final few metres, we felt a sense of achievement.
achievement.translation[0].note_box[0].s: Winning the award was a great achievement.
In recognition of this remarkable achievement he was awarded the OBE.
Writing the book was a major achievement.
Eisenhower' s outstanding achievement was to avoid war.
These studies represent a considerable achievement.
Her appointment to the Paris post was the crowning achievement of her life.
Few people realised what an enormous achievement Concorde represented.
He got the top mark in the country which is no mean achievement.
Working and bringing up kids on your own is quite an achievement.
